member.name: M:Contoso.Cloud.Integration.Framework.Data.ReliableSqlConnection.GetDnsSafeConnectionString(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Modifies the specified connection string to potentially improve reliability of a connection to SQL Azure database. It is achieved through reducing the dependency on public DNS by replacing the SQL Azure virtual host name specified in the connection string with its resolved IP address. Once name resolution is successfully completed, any further interaction with a SQL Azure database will be made using the IP address as opposed to the actual name of the SQL Azure virtual server.
member.param: The connection string that will be parsed and modified if required.
True if action needs to be asynchronous, otherwise false. When asynchronous action is requested, modifications are performed in the background and may not be reflected immediately.
member.returns: The modified connection string some parameters of which are modified to improve reliability of the connection to a SQL Azure database.

member.name: T:Contoso.Cloud.Integration.Framework.Data.ThrottlingMode
member.summary: Defines the possible throttling modes in SQL Azure.

member.name: F:Contoso.Cloud.Integration.Framework.Data.ThrottlingMode.NoThrottling
member.summary: Corresponds to "No Throttling" throttling mode whereby all SQL statements can be processed.

member.name: F:Contoso.Cloud.Integration.Framework.Data.ThrottlingMode.RejectUpdateInsert
member.summary: Corresponds to "Reject Update / Insert" throttling mode whereby SQL statements such as INSERT, UPDATE, CREATE TABLE and CREATE INDEX are rejected.

member.name: F:Contoso.Cloud.Integration.Framework.Data.ThrottlingMode.RejectAllWrites
member.summary: Corresponds to "Reject All Writes" throttling mode whereby SQL statements such as INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE, CREATE, DROP are rejected.

member.name: F:Contoso.Cloud.Integration.Framework.Data.ThrottlingMode.RejectAll
member.summary: Corresponds to "Reject All" throttling mode whereby all SQL statements are rejected.

member.name: F:Contoso.Cloud.Integration.Framework.Data.ThrottlingMode.Unknown
member.summary: Corresponds to an unknown throttling mode whereby throttling mode cannot be determined with certainty.

member.name: T:Contoso.Cloud.Integration.Framework.Data.ThrottlingType
member.summary: Defines the possible throttling types in SQL Azure.

member.name: F:Contoso.Cloud.Integration.Framework.Data.ThrottlingType.None
member.summary: Indicates that no throttling was applied to a given resource.

member.name: F:Contoso.Cloud.Integration.Framework.Data.ThrottlingType.Soft
member.summary: Corresponds to a Soft throttling type. Soft throttling is applied when machine resources such as, CPU, IO, storage, and worker threads exceed predefined safety thresholds despite the load balancers best efforts.

member.name: F:Contoso.Cloud.Integration.Framework.Data.ThrottlingType.Hard
member.summary: Corresponds to a Hard throttling type. Hard throttling is applied when the machine is out of resources, for example storage space. With hard throttling, no new connections are allowed to the databases hosted on the machine until resources are freed up.

member.name: F:Contoso.Cloud.Integration.Framework.Data.ThrottlingType.Unknown
member.summary: Corresponds to an unknown throttling type in the event when the throttling type cannot be determined with certainty.

member.name: M:Contoso.Cloud.Integration.Framework.Instrumentation.ITraceEventProvider.TraceIn(System.Object[])
member.summary: Writes an informational event into the trace log indicating that a method is invoked. This can be useful for tracing method calls to help analyze the code execution flow. The method will also write the same event into default System.Diagnostics trace listener, however this will only occur in the DEBUG code. A call to the TraceIn method would typically be at the very beginning of an instrumented code.
member.param: The method parameters which will be included into the traced event (make sure you do not supply any sensitive data).
member.returns: An unique value which can be used as a correlation token to correlate TraceIn and TraceOut calls.

member.name: M:Contoso.Cloud.Integration.Framework.Instrumentation.ITraceEventProvider.TraceIn
member.summary: Writes an informational event into the trace log indicating that a method is invoked. This can be useful for tracing method calls to help analyze the code execution flow. The method will also write the same event into default System.Diagnostics trace listener, however this will only occur in the DEBUG code. A call to the TraceIn method would typically be at the very beginning of an instrumented code. This method is provided to ensure optimal performance when no parameters are required to be traced.
member.returns: An unique value which can be used as a correlation token to correlate TraceIn and TraceOut calls.

member.name: M:Contoso.Cloud.Integration.Framework.Instrumentation.ITraceEventProvider.TraceIn(System.Guid)
member.summary: Writes an informational event into the trace log indicating that a method is invoked. This can be useful for tracing method calls to help analyze the code execution flow. The method will also write the same event into default System.Diagnostics trace listener, however this will only occur in the DEBUG code. A call to the TraceIn method would typically be at the very beginning of an instrumented code. This overload should be used when correlation token (callToken) is defined by the calling code.
member.param: An unique value which is used as a correlation token to correlate TraceIn and TraceOut calls.

member.name: M:Contoso.Cloud.Integration.Framework.Instrumentation.ITraceEventProvider.TraceOut(System.Object[])
member.summary: Writes an informational event into the trace log indicating that a method is about to complete. This can be useful for tracing method calls to help analyze the code execution flow. The method will also write the same event into default System.Diagnostics trace listener, however this will only occur in the DEBUG code. A call to the TraceIn method would typically be at the very end of an instrumented code, before the code returns its result (if any).
member.param: The method parameters which will be included into the traced event (make sure you do not supply any sensitive data).

member.name: M:Contoso.Cloud.Integration.Framework.Instrumentation.ITraceEventProvider.TraceOut
member.summary: Writes an informational event into the trace log indicating that a method is about to complete. This can be useful for tracing method calls to help analyze the code execution flow. The method will also write the same event into default System.Diagnostics trace listener, however this will only occur in the DEBUG code. A call to the TraceIn method would typically be at the very end of an instrumented code, before the code returns its result (if any). This method is provided to ensure optimal performance when no parameters are required to be traced.

member.name: M:Contoso.Cloud.Integration.Framework.Instrumentation.ITraceEventProvider.TraceOut(System.Guid,System.Object[])
member.summary: Writes an informational event into the trace log indicating that a method is about to complete. This can be useful for tracing method calls to help analyze the code execution flow. The method will also write the same event into default System.Diagnostics trace listener, however this will only occur in the DEBUG code. A call to the TraceIn method would typically be at the very end of an instrumented code, before the code returns its result (if any).
member.param: An unique value which is used as a correlation token to correlate TraceIn and TraceOut calls.
The method parameters which will be included into the traced event (make sure you do not supply any sensitive data).

member.name: M:Contoso.Cloud.Integration.Framework.Instrumentation.ComponentTraceEventProvider.TraceIn(System.Object[])
member.summary: Writes an informational event into the trace log indicating that a method is invoked. This can be useful for tracing method calls to help analyze the code execution flow. The method will also write the same event into default System.Diagnostics trace listener, however this will only occur in the DEBUG code. A call to the TraceIn method would typically be at the very beginning of an instrumented code.
member.param: The method parameters which will be included into the traced event (make sure you do not supply any sensitive data).
member.returns: An unique value which can be used as a correlation token to correlate TraceIn and TraceOut calls.

member.name: M:Contoso.Cloud.Integration.Framework.Instrumentation.ComponentTraceEventProvider.TraceIn
member.summary: Writes an informational event into the trace log indicating that a method is invoked. This can be useful for tracing method calls to help analyze the code execution flow. The method will also write the same event into default System.Diagnostics trace listener, however this will only occur in the DEBUG code. A call to the TraceIn method would typically be at the very beginning of an instrumented code. This method is provided to ensure optimal performance when no parameters are required to be traced.
member.returns: An unique value which can be used as a correlation token to correlate TraceIn and TraceOut calls.

member.name: M:Contoso.Cloud.Integration.Framework.Instrumentation.ComponentTraceEventProvider.TraceIn(System.Guid)
member.summary: Writes an informational event into the trace log indicating that a method is invoked. This can be useful for tracing method calls to help analyze the code execution flow. The method will also write the same event into default System.Diagnostics trace listener, however this will only occur in the DEBUG code. A call to the TraceIn method would typically be at the very beginning of an instrumented code. This overload should be used when correlation token (callToken) is defined by the calling code.
member.param: An unique value which is used as a correlation token to correlate TraceIn and TraceOut calls.

member.name: M:Contoso.Cloud.Integration.Framework.Instrumentation.ComponentTraceEventProvider.TraceOut(System.Object[])
member.summary: Writes an informational event into the trace log indicating that a method is about to complete. This can be useful for tracing method calls to help analyze the code execution flow. The method will also write the same event into default System.Diagnostics trace listener, however this will only occur in the DEBUG code. A call to the TraceOut method would typically be at the very end of an instrumented code, before the code returns its result (if any).
member.param: The method parameters which will be included into the traced event (make sure you do not supply any sensitive data).

A call to the TraceOut method would typically be at the very end of an instrumented code, before the code returns its result (if any). This method is provided to ensure optimal performance when no parameters are required to be traced.

member.name: F:Contoso.Cloud.Integration.Framework.RetryPolicy.DefaultExponential
